acf.heading: Get a hydroxyzine prescription online.
acf.first_paragraph: Select your symptoms within the Maple app so the doctor can evaluate your symptoms and condition. Enter as much information as possible so that the doctor can make a thorough assessment.

accordion.accordion_title: What is hydroxyzine and how does it work?
accordion.accordion_intro: Hydroxyzine is an antihistamine, which works by blocking a natural substance called histamine that your body makes during an allergic reaction. It also reduces activity in the central nervous system, and can be used as a sedative. Hydroxyzine is sold under the brand name Vistaril.

accordion.accordion_title: What are the uses for hydroxyzine?
accordion.accordion_intro: Hydroxyzine is used to treat itchy allergic skin reactions, such as hives or contact dermatitis. It is also used to treat short-term anxiety and tension, and is used with other drugs during or after surgery to increase sleepiness and relaxation.

Hydroxyzine is typically taken by mouth with or without food 3 to 4 times a day, as directed by a doctor. If you are using the liquid form of hydroxyzine, always shake the bottle before pouring the medication into the provided measuring cup to ensure you get the right dose. Hospitals may administer this drug intravenously.

accordion.accordion_title: What are the side effects and risks of hydroxyzine?
accordion.accordion_intro:
Common side effects of hydroxyzine include:

  • Drowsiness
  • Dizziness
  • Blurred vision
  • Constipation
  • Dry mouth
accordion.accordion_content: In rare cases, hydroxyzine may lower your heart rate, cause shortness of breath, or cause puffiness or swelling of the face. Contact your doctor immediately if this happens to you. Hydroxyzine can also cause QT prolongation, which can rarely cause serious heart complications. Avoid alcohol as it can make dizziness and drowsiness worse.

accordion.accordion_intro: Do not take this medication if you are pregnant, as it can cause birth defects. If you are allergic to hydroxyzine, cetirizine, or levocetirizine, ask your doctor for alternative medication. If you have high blood pressure, breathing problems, liver or kidney disease, or an overactive thyroid, speak with your doctor or pharmacist about whether this medication is right for you.
accordion.accordion_content: If you have any questions about the medication, you can speak to a doctor on Maple by registering for an account.
